lead_paragraph: "Perhaps you've never heard of the choreographer Faye Driscoll. But if you're reasonably plugged into the contemporary arts scene in New York, chances are you've seen some of her work," writes Claudia La Rocco. " 'Loneliness,' her video flip-book dance, was part of the New Museum's 'Younger Than Jesus' triennial. She was a member of Doug Varone and Dancers, has performed with Yasmeen Godder and served as the choreographic assistant to David Neumann, when he created a duet for himself and Mikhail Baryshnikov." Those who want to get more familiar with her work should head to Dance Theater Workshop to see "There Is So Much Mad in Me." "The piece, which includes fine dancers like Tony Orrico and Lindsay Clark, is drawn in part from media images of people in extreme states and investigates their enduring need to be seen. What better time to catch a glimpse of Ms. Driscoll?"
